title: People who dodge at last second should have to wait much longer
body:
Title.
It's pretty clear that if someone dodges at last second they are intentionally trying to waste people's time.

Therefore, they should have to waste their own time as well.

replies.body:
Or they can just be contemplating if they want to dodge? Or waiting to see if someone else will bail out first? 

How can you say they're intentionally wasting your time?

> [{quoted}](name=zFrostistic,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=HBxcia7N,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-06-02T14:40:30.385+0000)
>
> Or they can just be contemplating if they want to dodge? Or waiting to see if someone else will bail out first? 
> 
> How can you say they're intentionally wasting your time?

Those are still examples of someone intentionally wasting everyone's time. If you want to dodge because you want to invite someone or what ever just do it, waiting to see if someone else will (sometimes includes troll picking) means you are choosing to waste time in hopes you save your time.

While I would like people who do this to receive a longer dodge penalty, because being in que for 7+ minutes only to have 5 last second dodges in a row does get annoying, I don't think it would work out. The client still has some odd issues with crashing etc, and being forced to dodge with an extended penalty would suck.
If someone dodged because someone locked in a "troll pick" I'd be glad they at least dodged.

> [{quoted}](name=zFrostistic,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=HBxcia7N,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2017-06-03T02:52:33.454+0000)
>
> If someone dodged because someone locked in a "troll pick" I'd be glad they at least dodged.

I meant, lets say you want to dodge because a friend wants to play but you don't want the penalty, so you not only wait for the last second to dodge but you lock in a troll pick to get someone else to dodge for you, and if they don't then you dodge last second. Sometimes the person who wants to dodge doesn't dodge, or the client didn't register they did and the game starts anyways with a troll pick.

So what she your point here? 

So you're going to be an asshole to get someone to dodge because you want to play with your friend? Tell your friend to wait.

^
This is significantly more likely than them wanting to waste the time of 9 complete strangers whom they have not met and never will.

What they are doing is hoping someone else dodges first so they don't have to.

Also, how are you going to differentiate that from DCs?

Which is why it would be beneficial to have a scaling dodge timer.  If dodging at the last second adds 10-20 minutes to your dodge timer, but dodging earlier only adds a minute or 2, people would (presumably) be more likely to just bite the bullet instead of wasting everyone else's time.

As for DCs, if you DC because of internet issues, chances are you probably shouldn't be playing a game that requires a persistent internet connection until you've sorted it out or determined if it was just an isolated event.

It would be unfair to people who DC because of the client borking things up though, although, at least in my experience, that's a rare edge case at worst.

You can't really do much about this though.
Why should people who dodge at the last second be punished more than just normal dodgers, even if both are doing the same thing?

I get a lot of trolls in champ select, had someone not dodged, I'm fairly sure I would've.

People dodging are saving us from 20 minutes of time being wasted.
Dodging should scale with time left. If they dodge at the first second, it should be only 2 minutes. Dodging at last second should be an upward of 10-15.

The issue is that this would target a lot of people who are not dodging to waste time, but for other reasons. Maybe last minute they get called to do something, or they're waiting to see if anyone else dodges, or what if they're having simple lag issues with the new client? You simply can't know, which is why all dodgers get the same penalty.
doesn't the dodge timer still tick even if you're not trying to get into a game? people would not need to wait as long if they needed to do something.
Well, I've been in a lobby, doing last minute setup, and then my mom would come in asking me to go to the store, etc. It happens.
Not the point, if you come back after you did that thing at the store, you won't have a dodge timer anymore.

Really, it's CLEAR that I'm just dodging to waste your time because I waited till last second? Maybe I'm thinking about the team comps and our chances of winning and whether or not I think I can carry with my champ or checking stats of our carry champs to see if they're really even capable of carrying. Maybe I'm hoping someone else dodges before I do so I don't get leaverbuster. Maybe I'm deciding on my runes and masteries and our team doesn't look that hot so I just decide fuck it and dodge because I'm running out of time and Im not too hopeful in the first place. I've never once thought, oh this guy only dodged to waste my time. Like, what kind of victim mentality is that? You think people are just out to get you and waste your time a lot? You should try to lose that mentality.

So I just decided to play draft normals and check if the 10 bans have arrived yet. What I get is a person who picks kindred jungle and takes heal, we all spam him to take smite and he says "no, kindred is adc" . And what the fuck do I do then, obviously I have a mongoloid on my team so I just wait untill the last few seconds and hope that someone else dodges, if they dont then I do. Its not my intention to waste time in any way. This is why we need a lobby report system, some people just arent ready for PvP or they troll in champ select.

Yes for summoners rift and no for ARAM because if I get{{champion:77}}, then you better believe that I'm dodging and I'll wait till the 2 second mark because I've tried at 1 second and it didn't work. I do this to see if someone will dodge first.

> [{quoted}](name=ENB,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=HBxcia7N,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-06-02T14:22:11.940+0000)
>
> Yes for summoners rift and no for ARAM because if I get{{champion:77}}, then you better believe that I'm dodging and I'll wait till the 2 second mark because I've tried at 1 second and it didn't work. I do this to see if someone will dodge first.

So because it's something you personally do, we shouldn't enforce that, but since you don't do that on the rift, sure implement it. See the problem with your train of thought there? Seems pretty self centered.
